abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental and social framework
            for the Tanzania Secondary Education Development Program
            Project discusses potential negative environmental impacts
            and proposes measures to mitigate them. Expected adverse
            environmental impacts include: Poor planning may result in
            poor choice of school location, which ultimately will lead
            to land degradation and soil erosion, water (surface and
            ground) contamination, degradation of natural habitats and
            wetland ecosystems. During construction, poor performance of
            civil works contractors may leads to unsuccessful
            incorporation of mitigation measures. Poor implementation of
            the maintenance plan during operational phases of the public
            service infrastructure/school may be caused by lack of
            funds, negligence of staff, or failure to monitor. Adverse
            social impacts may arise from the absence of a participatory
            process involving local communities when the government
            prepares their school development plans; exclusion of
            vulnerable groups due to barriers to access derived from
            stigmatization, acute poverty, discrimination, and lack of
            participation in the planning process; and land acquisition
            resulting in involuntary resettlement, and impacts on people
            and property.
